pages.text: In addition to the $(l:basics/pyre)Pyre$() and the required ingredients, some rituals require standing stones or runed pillars.$(br2)These two- or three- high blocks of $(l:resources/runestone)runestone$() or wood, capped with either $(l:resources/runestone#chiseled)chiseled runestone$() or $(l:resources/runed_wood)runed wood$(), are detailed in ritual entries.$(br2)$(info) Placement of these can vary from what is documented in images.

pages.name: Standing Stones
pages.text: Bricks can be used instead of normal runestone when forming the base.

pages.name: Standing Stones
pages.text: The maximum height required for standings stones and pillars is four blocks.

pages.name: Runed Pillar
pages.text: Runed Pillars can be constructed of any vanilla wood, and simply consists of logs topped with $(l:resources/runed_wood)runed wood$().

pages.name: Runed Pillar
pages.text: The type of wood required for the pillar will also be specified in the ritual entry.

pages.name: Standing Stones
pages.text: In addition to being wither- and ender dragon-proof, these standing stones are blast resistant.

pages.name: Standing Stones
pages.text: Runed obsidian bricks can be used instead of runed obsidian.

Indeed, not all rituals require standing stones or pillars, however, all rituals with such requirements will show an icon: $(standing_stones) along with a link to visualisation of one potential arrangement.$(br2)In addition, these displays can be visualised in-world by clicking on the eye in the bottom-left corner.
